column4: Is anyone here running ZFS? If so, what speeds are you seeing for read/write and what type of drives are you running it under?
!zfs
I wouldnt run it under ubuntu
thats under fuse right
no there's a native Linux module
ah ok, the one you have to compile yourself
yeah, I've already compiled and have it running native, but the performance I'm seeing is wretched. 22MB/sec writes. 40MB/sec reads.
with what RAID set and how many disks
TBH I wouldnt run it under linux.. the BSD version isnt that great either.. stick to OI or solaris
64bit and penty of RAM?
yeah, I'm looking at maybe installing Open Solaris but I'm not that comfortable moving my file server to an OS I know nothing about.
RAIDZ2 with 5 drives
64bit with 8GB of RAM, arc limit at 7
5 for now, and 2 more to be put in by the 15th
seems all ok.. RAIDZ2 will slow you down, but still
and you know you cant expand the RAIDZ2 set right
yeah, I'm not expecting 800MB/sec, but I was assuming at LEAST 50MB/sec write and 100MB/sec read.
wait, what? You can't expand the RAIDZ2 set? So I can't actually add more disks to the array?
no you cant.. you have to create a new array
should I just break it and create a RAIDZ array?
you really need to plan ZFS installs. have you read the best practices guide?
